[[Image:Dual boot icon.svg|thumb|Artist's depiction of a boot manager's menu offering a choice between Microsoft Windows and Linux operating systems.]]
'''Multi boot''' or '''Multi booting''' (usually '''dual booting''', but many [[Operating system|OSes]] can be booted from the same computer) is the act of installing multiple [[operating system]]s on a [[computer]], and being able to choose which one to [[Booting|boot]] when switching on the computer power. The program which makes multi booting possible is called a [[Booting#Second-stage boot loader|boot loader]].
'''Multi boot''' or '''Multi booting''' (usually '''dual booting''', but many [[Operating system|OSes]] can be booted from the same computer) is the act of installing multiple [[operating system]]s on a [[computer]], and being able to choose which one to [[Booting|boot]] when switching on the computer power. The program which makes multi booting possible is called a [[Booting#Second-stage boot loader|boot loader]].
